column4: hi I'm trying to build wine from source, but I get an error during configure saying C compiler cannot create executables. Do I have to be root or something?
apparently you can't build wine from source at all
apparently needs to be built with gcc-3.4, and you're probably going to have a tough time getting that working
ah, that would be a problem... oh well i don't really need wine
err wait someone else claims you just have to install libc6-dev-i386
what's wrong with wine in the repository?
uh? sounds like you have bigger problems :P
could not download all repository indexes
better fix that... which mirror are you using?
it might only be for i386
i386 should work for lotsa stuff... but there's a wine built in the normal ubuntu mirror...
I did a search for it and didn't see it in synaptic
yeah wine needs to be built 32-bit

nekr0z, I found a guide here http://www.ilfilosofo.com/blog/2007/01/12/installing-wine-on-ubuntu-edgy-610-64-bit/ but it involves overwriting symbolic links, and I want to know if I can do it in a way where I can undo it if it doesn't work
